stitch st/sts stitch/stitches st double_crochet standing double i start with a standing stitch with a slip knot on my hook crochet instead of yo twice only because i am paranoid about sts unravelling the correct way to do this is yo the hook twice insert into the indicated st/space and pull up a loop yo and pull through 2 loops yo and pull through 2 loops as you would work a double_crochet keep the tail taut whilst doing this st v st v_stitch 1dc ch2 1dc into the same space/st yo yarn over to get started make 4ch and slip_stitch into the 1st chain to form a ring alternatively you can start with a magic_ring/circle i always prefer a double magic_ring as i feel that this is somewhat stronger please remember to work away the initial tail very securely you do not want your work to unravel 2 round 1 make a beg dc2togcl in the ring ch1 dc2togcl 7 times ch1 slip_stitch into the beg dc2togcl 8 dc2togcl 8 chain-1 sps round 2 slip_stitch into the chain-1 space ch3 this counts as your 1st double_crochet double_crochet in the same space this makes up half of the 1st corner * 1fpdc around the dc2togcl 1dc in the chain-1 space 1fpdc around the next dc2togcl 2dc ch2 2dc into the chain-1 space* repeat from * to * 3 more times omitting the last 2dc ch2 2dc now work 2dc into the chain-1 space and 1hdc into the top of the beg ch3 the last half_double_crochet that is worked into the beg ch3 counts as your chain-2 space per side 2fpdc 1dc per corner 2dc ch2 2dc round 3 ch3 this counts as your 1st double_crochet 1dc in the space created by the half_double_crochet join again you are
